about.title: About me

heroIntro.story: My journey started from a simple curiosity: understanding how our Universe works. From studying the chaotic regime of Saturn's rings to simulating particle collisions (M2 - ATLAS), I developed a rigorous work methodology: knowledge synthesis, then focus on a key point with concrete application of my skills, especially in data analysis. This approach extends to my personal projects, such as building this website. Here, you'll discover my journey as well as articles about my projects and hobbies !

stats.reports: Reports and papers written in LaTeX

about.goalsText: Today, two paths are open to me: pursuing a PhD in experimental physics or joining a data science / data engineering project. Both represent exciting challenges, and regardless of which path I take, I'm ready to invest 100% to learn, contribute, and meet the challenges.

internshipProjectM2.description: Generation and analysis of simulated events to assess the feasibility of long-lived particle (LLP) searches at the HL-LHC. Production of HAHM scenarios (ggH and VH modes) and optimization of signal-to-background ratio. Characterization of LLP signatures and estimation of ATLAS detector acceptance.
